reviewText: When I purchased this DVD I would have wholeheartedly agreed with the previous reviewer "Squirrely Girl" - but something compelled me to give it a chance - so I stuck with it - and after a week or two I found I was catching on, that I was remembering and following the routine, and that it was actually providing me with a pretty good aerobic workout.  That said, it is still a problem that no slow warm-up is provided, and this is essential with aerobics.  The instructor jumps right in at 80MPH, and this is a mistake.  Other than that, I am happy with it, use it frequently, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a good basic aerobic workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one workout that I love to do and I can't say that about many.  It allows me to get in a great cardio workout and have fun while doing it.  I love to dance, but in my own way, and many other dance aerobic videos I have tried have very complicated steps.  Gay took some aerobic basics and made some really fun routines where you can add your own little moves to them!!!!I highly rely on reviews before I buy something so I hope this helps but I have a ton of fun doing this video...

reviewText: This tape is geared towards fitness DUMMIES  they teach you everything in explicit detail during your warm up.  Than u put those moves together in different "combos" for your aerobic workout.  The instruction is clear and right on the money every time.  You can make this tape easier or harder depending on how hard you wanna work.  most moves have modifications to make them hi or low impact.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I purchased the VHS version of this workout a few years back.  When I discovered that it was available on DVD and immediately purchased the DVD!  I would consider myself an intermediate exerciser but I wasn't one when I first purchased the tape.I found Gay Gasper to be a very pleasant instructor and she has excellent cueing.  She is very motivating and is one of the reasons that I will keep this tape in my library.  I didn't find the moves complicated and Gay does provide a 12 minute aerobic session where by she explains each of the aerobic moves.  So I am not sure why some reviewers had trouble doing the basic moves.  Gay suggests that you do the 12 minute session before the 38 minute "Feel The Heat" workout.  This will provide a 50 minute workout.I've had this workout for several years and frequently use the workout in my exericse rotation.
summary: I own this dvd and LOVE the workout!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a veteran of many an exercise tape and many years of taking aerobics classes.  Because I crave variety I have all sorts of exercise tapes in my collection but not many that feature just plain ole low impact aerobics so when I cam across this one and read the back of the video cover it seemed liked a good one to add to the collection.  When initially reviewing the tape I was sort of disappointed.  It looked so easy.  The instructor was going through each of the moves that would be used in later combos as part of the warmup.  They were all so easy and things I had learned years ago.  But as I watched the tape I did note that her form was excellent and it was actually kind of nice to only have to focus on a single person who you know is doing the exercise the correct way.  Sometimes the people in some of these exercise videos are not actually showing good form and it's annoying when the camera focuses on them during a critical changeover or difficult move.  Another plus is that during one of the four routines in the corner there is the same instructor showing you the high impact version of the exact exercise.I put the tape away at first and did not add it to my rotation.  A few months later I was coming off an illness and wanted something to gradually get me back into the swing of things.  I chose this tape and what a surprise.  Yes the moves are all basic and very easy but they work.  I always try to wear a heart rate monitor when I exercise to monitor the effectiveness of any exercise I am doing.  This has been invaluable.  Given that I was coming off an illness it didn't take long for me to get my heart rate up doing this tape and I also found that I couldn't finish the last combo.  I was baffled and a little put out that what appeared to be such an easy tape had stumped me.  A week later when I was feeling like my old self I did the tape again and while I could finish the tape easily this time I still was able to get my heart rate into the correct target zone.  I believe this tape is effective because someone has taken the time to involve all the major mucsle groups in such a way that not only requires a great deal of energy expediture but that keeps the moves simple.  You are also given enough options to make this work for anyone.  Feel like more energy on certain moves then do the high impact version.  It's that simple.  Because I have so many tapes it takes me awhile to cylce back to any one particular one but this one definitely got added to the "A" list.  While it's not anyhwere near the most exciting routine I have ever tried it does the job and that's what counts.  Another bonus is if you are a beginner to exercise it gives some great workout tips and bust some of the more common exercise myths/
summary: Basic, easy and a real fat burner.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have a new favorite workout.  Gay Gasper is one of the best instructors I have ever encountered.  She's cheerful (not at all annoying) and cues almost perfectly; i.e. she tells you the move before you do it and mirrors you.  As for the routine, it might be just a little bit fast moving for a person who has never done aerobics before, but the moves are easy enough that anyone should be able to catch on after a few tries.  She really does break the moves down well at the very beginning and everything is repeated often in the different combinations.  If you've done a couple of aerobic videos or classes, you'll have no problem with this.  Honestly, the moves aren't really any different from a typical Leslie Sansone workout:  sidesteps, grapevines, ham curls, knee ups, etc. Relatively low difficulty does not mean you won't sweat, though!  Gay really keeps you moving.  Plus, all through the workout there are high impact modifiers shown so that this is a workout you can easily grow with.  And you could always add weighted gloves to kick up the intensity a notch.So, to sum up: Gay is one of the best instructors out there, and for her to do a "beginners" workout is such a treat.  The routines may take a little bit of work for some, but they are fun and basic and worth the effort.  The music is good, though a little quiet.  It is a workout you can grow with, thanks to the modifiers shown.  And, finally, the "Dummies" pop-ups I've heard about are not nearly as annoying as I expected.  Once I got into the zone, they faded into the background and I hardly noticed them.  I was smiling the entire time, worked up a great sweat, and look forward to my next workout!I highly recommend this DVD to beginners to low intermediates.  Anyone higher than that might get bored with the basic choreography, but that's exactly what I love about this workout!
summary: Expect a lot of fun, but maybe not instant mastery

reviewText: This was the first aerobic dvd I ever bought. This is where I learned the moves that I use today when I do other workouts. I think it's a great dvd for anyone who wants to know what a grapevine and a mambo is - or any other basic step. I still work up a sweat while doing this but now I skip the first part. Whenever someone asks me if it's hard to do aerobics at home I just lend them this and let them try it out. So far - most of them have kept on working out :)

reviewText: I really love this workout. Unfortunately, I've had to replace it a few times already because the VHS wears out so quickly on this one. Its not a quality VHS. The workout, though, is GREAT ! I keep replacing it because its really a wonderful workout. Gay Gasper teaches you the moves and cues well. Modifications are shown so advanced exercisers can kick it up a notch. Its great for beginners and experienced exercisers alike. ...

reviewText: I have read some of the reviews that felt that this program was not organized and hard to follow for beginners. I feel differently. I am 53 years old and weigh 192 pounds. I feel that Gay has a pleasant voice tone and instructed well throughout the session. I believe that she flupped once when it was time to change legs; but that was it. She starts the session by going through each move individually and then she combines them for her Fat Burning session. It gets intense, but I found it easy to follow for the most part. Yes, I got confused at times. I think anyone would get mixed up with any aerobics routine. But, you just step back into place and keep going. The more you use the program, the more familiar you become with the program. It is not a competition nor is it an audition. It is something that you are using to get fit. I think that it is intense enough. It works for me.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've done other workouts for Dummies in the past and found them easy to follow. This workout is really the exception. At first it all seems very simple and you are required to march, do a V-step, easily do a heel dig, then do some knee lifts, a step touch and a grapevine. Then onwards to a ham curl, mambo and jazz square. The pace is slow and you can keep up with most of the moves if you are an intermediate or beginner. Then the chaos ensues. I say this because the rest of the DVD is almost impossible to follow. There are a number of combos which incorporate what you've already learned. This should be easy right? I found the combos to be very difficult to follow and I've done a lot of aerobics videos in my life. The footwork was extremely challenging for me to the point that I gave up after thirty minutes. If you hate fancy footwork you will not enjoy this DVD. I expected to feel a burn but I did not expect to feel so frustrated. I won't be doing this workout again.~The Rebecca Review
Title: N/A
